title: Rolls-Royce Cullinan review: breathtaking – and strangely unlovable
text:
It’s always good to learn how the other half lives. Start with the world’s stock of dollar millionaires, which last year rose to 22.6 million; every one potentially capable of buying a Rolls-Royce Cullinan. Or what about the 26 people who, according to a recent Oxfam report, own half the planet’s wealth? They could own a stable of these £276,000 gargantuan SUVs; one for every day of the week.

The big question is, would they want to? But then class never did walk hand in hand with wealth; Louis XIV, the Sun King, didn’t bestow the French nation with an unalloyed visual treats, and those Russian oligarchs’ mega-yachts bobbing in chi chi Mediterranean harbours hardly boast the finest nautical lines....
description: It’s always good to learn how the other half lives.
